We can think of $\purpleC{41}$ as $\purpleC{4\text{ tens}}$ and $\purpleC{1 \text{ one}}$.  

We can think of $\blueD{57}$ as $\blueD{5\text{ tens}}$ and $\blueD{7\text{ ones}}$.

$\phantom{=}\purpleC{41}+\blueD{57}$

$=\purpleC{4\text{ tens}}+\purpleC{1\text{ one}}+\blueD{5\text{ tens}}+\blueD{7\text{ ones}}$

$= \purpleC{4\text{ tens}}+\blueD{5\text{ tens}}+\purpleC{1\text{ one}}+\blueD{7\text{ ones}}$
The answer: $4 \text{ tens}+5\text{ tens} +1 \text{ one}+7 \text{ ones}$
